research_question: What is the role of preoperative imaging in the management of endometrial cancer?

pico.intervention: Preoperative imaging (ultrasound, MRI, CT, PET/CT, lymphoscintigraphy)
pico.outcomes: Staging, lymph node involvement, tumor grade, prognosis, need for lymphadenectomy, treatment planning

include: Studies evaluating preoperative imaging in endometrial cancer
exclude: Studies focusing solely on histopathological assessment
Studies unrelated to staging or treatment planning

example_in: A prospective study evaluating the use of 3D ultrasound in preoperative assessment of pelvic and abdominal spread in patients with ovarian cancer.
A comparative study on the diagnostic value of 3D ultrasound and diffusion-weighted MRI for preoperatively assessing myometrial invasion in endometrial cancer.
example_borderline: A retrospective analysis comparing lymphoscintigraphy and single photon emission computed tomography with computed tomography (SPECT/CT) for sentinel lymph node detection in endometrial cancer.
A study evaluating the prognostic value of preoperative dynamic contrast-enhanced magnetic resonance imaging in epithelial ovarian cancer.
example_out: A study focusing solely on histopathological assessment of pelvic lymph nodes in patients with cervical cancer.
A clinical trial evaluating a new chemotherapy regimen for endometrial cancer.
